metadata.title: CVE-2023-1281 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.description:
Use After Free vulnerability in Linux kernel traffic control index filter(tcindex) allows Privilege Escalation. The imperfect hash area can beupdated while packets are traversing, which will cause a use-after-freewhen 'tcf_exts_exec()' is called with the destroyed tcf_ext. A localattacker user can use this vulnerability to elevate its privileges to root.This issue affects Linux Kernel: from 4.14 before git commitee059170b1f7e94e55fa6cadee544e176a6e59c2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1281` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required
